column2: Long Live the Brotherhood
The Brotherhood is at its strongest when its members are united in purpose. Use this decision to guarantee a military alliance with the current Archmage Arcane.
Ally yourself with the Archmage Arcane.
Overthrow Archmage
The current Archmage Arcane is nothing compared to you. Be bold, and claim the Archmage seat for yourself.
Get a claim on the Arcane Brotherhood title.
Great Ritual
By summoning and binding a powerful ousider, you could get a wish. Wishes are risky, but potentially very beneficial.
Summon an outsider to get a wish.
The Archmage Arcane leads the Brotherhood with great wisdom and power. By pledging myself to the Archmage's cause, I will be able to ask the Brotherhood for help in my future wars.
We need this.
I'm stronger alone.
Great Archmage Arcane, leader of our Brotherhood, let me pledge myself to your service. No foe will stand before our combined power.
A useful alliance.
Your services are not required.
Dear brother, I gladly accept your suggestion. Serve the Brotherhood well, and you won't regret it.
Great!
Your offer is appreciated, but I'm afraid you haven't earned the honor of serving me yet.
Damn it.
As a respected and feared overwizard, I don't have much more room for further personal advancement in the Arcane Brotherhood. Unless I want to aim for the seat of the Archmage Arcane, that is.
Yes, I deserve to rule.
Wait, I might be making a terrible mistake here.

The pursuit of great power is always risky. I have decided to summon a great being from the outer planes, binding it to my will. A devil will surely test my abilities to read a contract properly, while a genie shall definitely challenge my cunning.
I'll summon a greater devil. I won't get fooled by their complex contracts.
A genie should be the safer option. I won't be outwitted.

And so, after days of exhausting casting, a great devil is now in front of me. It testes the secure magic circle that confines it, and then, after flashing an horrible smile, decides to speak: "So, dear mortal. Are you looking for a bargain?".
I demand strenght!
I shall be the most desirable being in all the lands.
Expand my mind, fiend.
There's no rush. We'll bargain for as much time as it is needed.

And so, after days of exhausting casting, a noble genie is now in front of me. It testes the secure magic circle that confines it, and sighs. "Another foolish mortal looking for trouble" it says "What is your wish?".
I wish for massive physical power.
I want to be valued, to be desired!.
You will increase my wits tenfold, genie.
Hold on. I'm sure I can come up with an ironclad wording.
Well played, mortal the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. Soon after, I feel my body rippling with new muscles!
Yes! Hahaha!
Oh, I'm sure you'll get what you really desire, mortal. Sometimes in your next life the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. Soon after, I feel my body growing weaker...
Noooo!
You played it safe, mortal. Probably a wise decision the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. Soon after, I feel a little better.
Eh, that's good enough.
Well played, mortal the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. I quickly fetch a mirror, and I look amazing!
Yes! Finally!

Oh, I'm sure you'll get what you really desire, mortal. Sometimes in your next life the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. I desperately fetch a mirror, and I can see my face wilting before my eyes...
Noooo!
You played it safe, mortal. Probably a wise decision the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. What in the hells just happened?
I feel a sudden...urge.
Well played, mortal the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. Suddenly, my mind starts coming up with solutions to problems I didn't even know I ever had.
The world is mine!
Oh, I'm sure you'll get what you really desire, mortal. Sometimes in your next life the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. What was I even doing here?
I'm hungry.

You played it safe, mortal. Probably a wise decision the creature in front of me snaps its fingers, and disappears. My mind is invaded by strange glimpses of things that do not yet exist, but could exist.
Summon my generals, my architects, my scholars!
Has not used the decision in the last 5 years
Can only use this decision once
Has not used the decision in the last 20 years
Apprentice
